intro: Caiophora spegazzinii, commonly known as the Spegazzini's caiophora, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous areas with well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
